info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 20 at 5:06AM EDT until August 20 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions expected.
* Waves: Waves 3 to 4 feet this morning will subside to 1 to 3 feet late this morning. Waves will build back closer to 3 feet late this afternoon.
* Life-threatening rip currents will persist through late morning, diminishing in intensity through the day as wave heights diminish.
* Life-threatening structural currents expected, especially on the north sides of piers and breakwalls. Structural currents will likely persist even once wave heights subside.
* A strong longshore current flowing from north to south is expected.
* WHERE...Northern Berrien county.
* WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...There may be a lull in wave heights to around 1 to 2 feet early this afternoon as winds diminish slightly. Winds and waves will begin to pick up later this afternoon and evening, with waves returning to closer to 3 feet. The beach hazards statement may be extended into the evening hours depending on conditions late this morning.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Do not venture out on piers.

parameter.value: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING
